discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
After the content download is complete, the updated content is pulled into the staging columns of the Software Publishers (samp_sw_publisher), Software Products (samp_sw_product), Discovery maps (samp_sw_entitlement_definition), and Software Product Definitions (samp_sw_product_definition) tables. A query runs and identifies what transactional data in your instance must be updated with the new content. After the changes are identified, the changes are then propagated to your instance

Selected Answer: A
If the ServiceNow instance is SN hosted, a weekly job runs to automatically pull normalization library content data from the content server. Determining whether the content has been pulled:
- Query Download Schedules (cds_client_schedule) for each table starting with “samp_”. The Last Updated On column will contain when the data for that table was last pulled from the content server.
- In the content that ships with the plugin, there are over 7,700 records in samp_sw_package table.

Selected Answer: A
The content service tables starts with samp_sw

questions.question_text: What table is populated with the content library data that is pulled from the content service?
When specified during an entitlement import, which of the following is matched to data in the Content Service Library and used to create a software model automatically?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
From the course:
The Publisher Part Number is optional, yet recommended. If available, the import process will automate matching this Software Entitlement with the correct Software Model, creating it if it doesn’t already exist. If you do not have this field, the next four fields are mandatory (publisher, product, version, and edition). Since the solution must match every Software Entitlement with a Software Model, if the publisher part number were not present, the next four fields combined would identify the Software Model in lieu of automating it via publisher part number.

Selected Answer: BC
Discovery models are compared to ServiceNow's Software Content Library
As part of the software normalization process, software discovery models are normalized:
 • Business Rule Create a Software Normalization executes before insert/update and normalizes (Publisher, Product, and Version ) discovery model using the exact match rules (samp_package_map, samp_product_map, cds_client_name). Pattern based rules are not run during execution of the business rule.
 • Scheduled job Discovery Model Normalization (sysauto_script) runs daily.
 ○ Processes all discovery models that are not normalized or manually normalized.
 § First attempts to normalize based on the exact match rules (package, product, publisher).
 § Then applies the pattern based rules in batch across the remaining discovery models.

Selected Answer: BC
8. Normalization of software discovery models:
a. Business Rule Create a Software Normalization executes before insert/update and normalizes discovery model using the exact match rules (samp_package_map, samp_product_map, cds_client_name). Pattern based rules are not run during execution of the business rule
b. Scheduled job Discovery Model Normalization (sysauto_script) runs daily.
i. Processes all discovery models that are not normalized or manually normalized.
1. First attempts to normalize based on the exact match rules (package, product, publisher).
2. Then applies the pattern based rules in batch across the remaining discovery models.

Selected Answer: BC
Discovery models are compared to ServiceNow’s Software Content Library:
- Business rule ‘Create a Software Normalization’ executes and normalizes discovery model using the exact match rules. 
- Scheduled job ‘Discovery Model Normalization (sysauto_script) runs daily.
o Processes all Discovery models that are not normalized or manually normalized.
o First attempts on exact match rules (package, product, publisher), then applies pattern based rules.
I Agree with fmineo - the correct answer is B & C - that excerpt is from page 132 of the text for the SN SAM Pro course.

questions.question_text: As part of the software normalization process, software discovery models are normalized via which mechanisms? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-it-asset-management/page/product/software-asset-management2/reference/normalization-status.html

A discovery model is partially normalized based on publisher and product fields only. In this case, the version field is editable and once that information is added the normalization status is changed to Manually Normalized.

choices.A: A discovery model normalized based on publisher field alone.
choices.B: The software discovery model has not yet completed its run through the normalization process.
choices.D: A discovery model was normalized based on publisher, product, version fields.
choices.C: A discovery model was normalized based on publisher and product fields only.

questions.question_text: What is the definition of Partially Normalized?
What is the name of the Scheduled job that runs daily for normalization?

discussion.content:

Discovery models are compared to ServiceNow’s Software Content Library:
- Business rule ‘Create a Software Normalization’ executes and normalizes discovery model using the exact match rules. 
- Scheduled job ‘Discovery Model Normalization (sysauto_script) runs daily.
o Processes all Discovery models that are not normalized or manually normalized.
o First attempts on exact match rules (package, product, publisher), then applies pattern based rules.

Selected Answer: D
Seems to have changed, but D is closest:
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-it-asset-management/page/product/software-asset-management2/concept/ml-learning-sam.html

The scheduled job, SAM-Normalize discovery models using content library rules, triggers on a daily basis and normalizes the discovery models based on the content rules.

Answer is A
